intro: Dugaldia chrysanthemoides, commonly known as the golden chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that resemble chrysanthemums, hence its common name. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and woodland edges. Dugaldia chrysanthemoides is often found in dry, well-drained soils and is adapted to warm climates.
